Description: Theodore John Kaczynski was born in Chicago, Illinois, to working-class Polish American parents Wanda Theresa Dombek and Theodore Richard Kaczynski, a sausage maker. His parents were raised Roman Catholic but later became atheists.
From first through fourth grade, Kaczynski attended Sherman Elementary School in Chicago. School administrators described him as healthy and well-adjusted.
After the birth of his younger brother David, the Kaczynski family moved to Evergreen Park, a suburb of Chicago. Ted transferred to Evergreen Park Central Junior High School.
Kaczynski tested with an IQ of 167 and skipped the sixth grade. He later described this as a pivotal event that led to social isolation and bullying from older classmates.
Neighbors described the Kaczynski family as civic-minded and devoted to their children. Ted was remembered as extremely intelligent but socially isolated.
Kaczynski attended Evergreen Park Community High School, where he excelled academically and was known for his intelligence rather than his personality.
During high school, Kaczynski played trombone in the marching band and joined multiple clubs, including mathematics, biology, coin collecting, and German.
Kaczynski became intensely interested in mathematics, spending hours solving advanced problems and associating with other academically gifted students known as the 'briefcase boys.'
Kaczynski skipped the eleventh grade, attended summer school, and graduated from high school at age 15. He was a National Merit finalist.
At age 15, Kaczynski was accepted to Harvard University on scholarship and began attending at age 16. Former classmates noted he was emotionally unprepared.
During his first year at Harvard, Kaczynski lived at 8 Prescott Street, a residence intended for younger and exceptionally gifted students.
For the remainder of his undergraduate years, Kaczynski lived at Eliot House, where peers described him as intelligent but socially reserved.
Kaczynski earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in mathematics from Harvard University with a GPA of 3.12.

During his second year at Harvard, Kaczynski participated in a psychological study led by Henry Murray involving intense verbal attacks on his personal beliefs. He spent approximately 200 hours in the study.
